title: 100 days strong
body:
100 days ago today, I sat down and decided to write a blog. Now, roughly 2,400 hours later, I find myself fighting back tears as I reminisce about the good ol' days... back when I thought saying "Mimosas for everyone!" was funny... back when I knew where my hat was... back when the summer was young and I was all of 23 years old. Sigh.

Those days are gone.

I'd like to think I've matured a little over the last 144,000 minutes. Sure, I still let my hair down and act like an 8 day-old once in awhile , but after all the joshin' and pussy-footin' is through, I settle back into my 8,640,000 second-old blog body and hit the sack. I've got blog kids to feed, you know. I can't be thinking only of myself.

Even though I rarely write on the weekends, I've still managed to think of a new post every 1.75 days. Over the last 8,640,000,000 milliseconds, I've served up nearly 30,000 incredibly funny words, including, but not limited to: mimosas, hat, the, fork, five deck platterpus, wizz, and weenus. On average, this blog has seen 504 readers per day, which isn't too bad considering my frequent use of the word weenus.

It certainly has been a long, strange journey for us all. I can remember my first comment like it was yesterday....

Dan says...
Testing the comments. I'm testing. I am Dan and I am testing. Blah blah blah blah. Testing the bold tags. Blah. Blah blah. Weenus.

Those were the days.

It's Was a Very Good Blog

When the blog was seventeen (days old)
It was a very good blog
It was a very good blog for me, Justin, and Nicole
And a warm buttered roll
My posts were silly and pithy
Nothing ryhmes with pithy
When the blog was seventeen

When the blog was twenty-one (days old)
It was a very good blog
It was a very good blog for blogger's "Blogs of Note"
Which I hadn't heard of before
Cause I'm an intellectual bore
I once ran into a door
When the blog was twenty-four ("one" doesn't rhyme as well as "four")

When the blog was thirty-five (days old)
It was a very good blog
It was a very good blog for talking about theater names
And singing karaoke with British dames
While watching the Cardinals games
And wishing I was Corey Haim(s)
When the blog was thirty-five

But now the days grow short
The blog is in the autumn of the day
Which equates to being roughly 6:43 PM
But the blog will go on
Because my name is actually Don
And my wife's named Shafon
Those last two lines are wrong

It was a mess of good days
Weenus.
author: Dan

Al, you mean to tell me that there AREN'T 60 hours in a day? Damn you, public education!

Janet, just waxing nostalgic and goofing off. I'll probably be around for at least another 15,000 days.

Sybille, thanks for reading.

Eina, don't put your weenus too close to the pussy-foot or else Google will have a cow!
